title: String Surgery
hint: Use ci" to change the text inside double quotes
solutionExplanation: ci" — 'change inside quotes': deletes the text inside the nearest double quotes and enters Insert mode. Type 'Hi'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Empty the Call
hint: Use di( to delete everything inside the parentheses
solutionExplanation: di( — 'delete inside parentheses': deletes everything between the matching ( and ) while keeping the parentheses themselves.

title: Brace Swap
hint: Use ci{ to change everything inside the braces at once
solutionExplanation: ci{ — 'change inside braces': deletes everything between { and } and enters Insert mode. Type 'x'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: SHOUT It Out
hint: Use gUiw to uppercase the word, or viwU with visual mode
solutionExplanation: gUiw — 'uppercase inside word': the gU operator uppercases text, and iw selects the inner word. Uppercases 'http' to 'HTTP'.

title: Quiet Down
hint: Use Vu to select the line visually and lowercase it
solutionExplanation: Vu — V selects the entire line in Visual Line mode. u lowercases the selection.

title: Loud String
hint: Use gUi" to uppercase only the text inside quotes
solutionExplanation: gUi" — the gU operator uppercases text, and i" is the 'inside quotes' text object. Uppercases only the text between the double quotes.

title: Find the Bug
hint: Use /py to search for the transposed letters, then xp to swap characters
solutionExplanation: /py<CR> — searches forward for 'py' (the transposed letters in 'tpyo'). xp — x deletes the character under cursor, p pastes it after — a classic Vim trick to swap two adjacent characters.

title: Star Search
hint: Use * to jump to the next occurrence of the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: * — searches forward for the next occurrence of the word under cursor ('x'). rq — replaces the 'x' on line 6 with 'q'.

title: Reverse Lookup
hint: Use ? to search backward, n to go to previous match, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: ?x<CR> — searches backward for 'x'. n — moves to the next match backward (the first 'x' on line 1). ry — replaces it with 'y'.

title: Color Swap

before.text: color: red; bg: red; border: red; outline: red;

after.text: color: blue; bg: blue; border: blue; outline: blue;

hint: Use :s/red/blue/g to substitute all occurrences on the line
solutionExplanation: :s/red/blue/g<CR> — substitute command: replaces all occurrences of 'red' with 'blue' on the current line. The g flag means 'global' (all matches, not just the first).

title: Global Rename
hint: Use :%s/var/let to substitute across all lines in the file
solutionExplanation: :%s/var/let<CR> — the % range means 'all lines in the file'. Replaces the first 'var' on each line with 'let'.

title: Unit Swap
hint: Use :s/px/em/g to replace all px units with em on this line
solutionExplanation: :s/px/em/g<CR> — substitutes all 'px' with 'em' on the current line. The g flag replaces all occurrences.

title: Semicolon Sprint
hint: Use A; to append semicolon, then j. to repeat on each line below
solutionExplanation: A;<Esc> — appends ';' at end of line 1. j. — moves down and repeats the last change. j. — repeats again on line 3.

title: Bullet Points
hint: Use I to insert at line start, type '- ', Esc, then j. to repeat
solutionExplanation: I- <Esc> — inserts '- ' at the beginning of line 1. j. — moves down and repeats. j. — repeats on line 3.

title: Macro Power

before.text:
1 apple
2 banana
3 cherry
4 date
5 elderberry
6 fig
7 grape
8 honeydew

after.text:
1. apple
2. banana
3. cherry
4. date
5. elderberry
6. fig
7. grape
8. honeydew

hint: Record a macro with q{reg}: append '.', move to next line. Then replay with @{reg}
solutionExplanation: qz — starts recording macro into register z. a.<Esc>j0 — appends '.', returns to Normal, moves to next line start. q — stops recording. 7@z — replays the macro 7 times for the remaining lines.

title: Quote Replace
hint: Use ci" to change the text inside quotes
solutionExplanation: ci" — 'change inside quotes': deletes 'old' inside the quotes and enters Insert mode. Type 'new'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Empty Brackets
hint: Use di[ to delete everything inside brackets
solutionExplanation: di[ — 'delete inside brackets': deletes everything between [ and ] while keeping the brackets.

title: Upper Word
hint: Use viwU to uppercase the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: viwU — v enters Visual mode, iw selects the inner word, U uppercases the selection.

title: Upper Quotes
hint: Use vi"U to uppercase text inside quotes
solutionExplanation: vi"U — v enters Visual mode, i" selects inside quotes, U uppercases the selection.

title: Second Match
hint: Search for beta, move to the next match, then change the word
solutionExplanation: /beta<CR> — searches forward for 'beta', landing on line 3's 'beta'. n — moves to the next match. cw — changes the word. Type 'zeta'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Reverse Match
hint: Use ? to search backward, then change the match
solutionExplanation: ?fixme<CR> — searches backward for 'fixme', landing on line 2. cw — changes the word. Type 'fixed'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: First Only
hint: Use :s/foo/bar/ to replace only the first match on the line
solutionExplanation: :s/foo/bar/<CR> — substitute without the g flag replaces only the first occurrence of 'foo' with 'bar' on the current line.

title: Global Path
hint: Use :%s/tmp/var/g to replace all occurrences
solutionExplanation: :%s/tmp/var/<CR> — replaces the first 'tmp' with 'var' on every line in the file. The % range applies to all lines.

title: Exclamation Run
hint: Append ! on the first line, then use j. to repeat
solutionExplanation: A!<Esc> — appends '!' at the end of line 1. j. — moves down and repeats. j. — repeats on line 3.

title: Macro Semicolons

before.text:
let a = 1
let b = 2
let c = 3
let d = 4

hint: Record a macro to append ; and move down, then replay
solutionExplanation: qa — starts recording macro into register a. A;<Esc>j — appends ';' at end of line and moves down. q — stops recording. 3@a — replays the macro 3 times for remaining lines.

title: Around Word
hint: Use daw to delete a word and the surrounding space ("around" word)
solutionExplanation: daw — 'delete around word': deletes the word under the cursor plus surrounding whitespace, removing 'big ' cleanly.

title: Strip Parens
hint: Use da( to delete the parentheses and everything inside them
solutionExplanation: da( — 'delete around parentheses': deletes the parentheses and everything inside them.

title: Lowercase Word
hint: Use guiw to lowercase the entire word under the cursor
solutionExplanation: guiw — the gu operator lowercases text, and iw is the 'inner word' text object. Lowercases 'HELLO' to 'hello'.

title: Hash Search
hint: Use # to search backward for the word under cursor, then r to replace
solutionExplanation: # — searches backward for the word under cursor ('foo'), jumping to line 1. ra — replaces 'f' with 'a'.
